fields.name: Barbell Bench Press
fields.description: A compound movement that targets the chest.
fields.starting_position: Lie on the bench with the barbell at arm's length.
fields.execution: Lower the barbell to the chest and press it back up.
fields.tips: Keep your feet flat on the floor and maintain a stable core throughout the movement.

fields.name: Incline Dumbbell Bench Press
fields.description: An upper-chest exercise using dumbbells on an incline bench.
fields.starting_position: Lie on an incline bench, holding dumbbells at chest height.
fields.execution: Press the dumbbells up until arms are extended.
fields.tips: Ensure that your elbows are at a 45-degree angle to your body during the press.

fields.name: Peck Deck
fields.description: Machine exercise targeting the chest muscles.
fields.starting_position: Sit on the machine with arms extended.
fields.execution: Bring your arms together in front of your chest.
fields.tips: Control the movement and squeeze your chest at the peak contraction.

fields.name: Cable Crossover
fields.description: A cable exercise for targeting the chest.
fields.starting_position: Stand in front of two cable machines with handles.
fields.execution: Pull the cables together in front of you, elbows slightly bent.
fields.tips: Focus on bringing the cables together with your chest, not just your arms.

fields.name: Incline Barbell Bench Press
fields.description: An upper-chest exercise using a barbell on an incline bench.
fields.starting_position: Lie on an incline bench, barbell at arm's length.
fields.execution: Lower the barbell to the upper chest and press it back up.
fields.tips: Keep your shoulders retracted and don't let them shrug during the press.

fields.name: Dumbbell Bench Press
fields.description: A free-weight chest exercise with dumbbells.
fields.starting_position: Lie on a bench with a dumbbell in each hand at chest height.
fields.execution: Press the dumbbells up until arms are extended.
fields.tips: Do not let the dumbbells drift too far out to the sides to avoid shoulder strain.

fields.name: Dumbbell Fly
fields.description: A chest exercise using dumbbells to target the pectoral muscles.
fields.starting_position: Lie on a bench with a dumbbell in each hand.
fields.execution: With arms slightly bent, lower the dumbbells to the sides and bring them together.
fields.tips: Keep a slight bend in the elbows to protect your shoulder joints.

fields.name: Incline Dumbbell Fly
fields.description: An incline version of the dumbbell fly for the upper chest.
fields.starting_position: Lie on an incline bench with a dumbbell in each hand.
fields.execution: With arms slightly bent, lower the dumbbells out to the sides and bring them together.
fields.tips: Maintain a controlled movement and focus on the stretch at the bottom.

fields.name: Chest Press Machine
fields.description: A machine-based exercise that isolates the chest muscles.
fields.starting_position: Sit in the chest press machine with hands gripping the handles.
fields.execution: Push the handles forward while keeping the elbows slightly bent.
fields.tips: Avoid locking your elbows at the peak of the movement to maintain tension on the chest.

fields.name: Barbell Declined Bench Press
fields.description: A decline version of the bench press that targets the lower chest.
fields.starting_position: Lie on a decline bench with the barbell at arm's length.
fields.execution: Lower the barbell to the lower chest and press it back up.
fields.tips: Focus on maintaining a stable and controlled descent to target the lower chest.

fields.name: Dumbbell Declined Bench Press
fields.description: A decline version of the dumbbell bench press for targeting the lower chest.
fields.starting_position: Lie on a decline bench with a dumbbell in each hand.
fields.execution: Press the dumbbells up from the lower chest and extend arms fully.
fields.tips: Focus on controlling the dumbbells during both the lowering and pressing phases.

fields.name: Push Ups
fields.description: A bodyweight exercise to target the chest, shoulders, and triceps.
fields.starting_position: Start in a plank position with hands under shoulders.
fields.execution: Lower your body until the chest almost touches the ground, then press back up.
fields.tips: Keep your core tight and avoid letting your hips sag during the movement.

fields.name: Dumbbell Bent-Over Row (Single Arm)
fields.description: A single-arm back exercise using dumbbells.
fields.starting_position: Kneel on a bench with one knee and one hand supporting your body, holding a dumbbell in the opposite hand.
fields.execution: Pull the dumbbell towards your hip while keeping your back flat.
fields.tips: Keep your back straight and avoid twisting your torso during the movement.

fields.name: Wide-Grip Pulldown
fields.description: A lat pulldown exercise using a wide grip to target the back.
fields.starting_position: Sit at the lat pulldown machine with a wide grip on the bar.
fields.execution: Pull the bar down to your chest, keeping your back straight.
fields.tips: Focus on squeezing your shoulder blades together as you pull the bar down.

fields.name: Seated Cable Row
fields.description: A seated row that targets the middle back muscles.
fields.starting_position: Sit at a cable row machine with your feet flat and hands gripping the cable handles.
fields.execution: Pull the handles towards your torso while keeping your back straight.
fields.tips: Keep your chest up and squeeze your shoulder blades at the end of the movement.

fields.name: Close-Grip Pulldown
fields.description: A lat pulldown variation using a close grip to target the lats and biceps.
fields.starting_position: Sit at the pulldown machine with a close grip on the bar.
fields.execution: Pull the bar down towards your chest, keeping elbows close to your sides.
fields.tips: Maintain a controlled movement and avoid using momentum to pull the bar down.

fields.name: Bent-Over Barbell Row
fields.description: A compound movement targeting the back and shoulders.
fields.starting_position: Stand with your knees slightly bent and grip a barbell with hands shoulder-width apart.
fields.execution: Pull the barbell towards your torso, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
fields.tips: Focus on keeping your back flat and your elbows close to your body.

fields.name: Behind-Neck Pulldown
fields.description: A lat pulldown variation that targets the upper lats.
fields.starting_position: Sit at the machine and grip the bar behind your neck.
fields.execution: Pull the bar down towards your upper chest, squeezing the shoulder blades.
fields.tips: Ensure your back is straight and avoid excessive leaning back.

fields.name: Reverse-Grip Pulldown
fields.description: A reverse grip lat pulldown that emphasizes the biceps and upper back.
fields.starting_position: Sit at the lat pulldown machine with palms facing towards you.
fields.execution: Pull the bar down towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.
fields.tips: Keep your core engaged to prevent swinging during the pull.

fields.name: Rope Pulldown
fields.description: A cable exercise targeting the lats and biceps.
fields.starting_position: Stand at the cable machine with a rope attachment.
fields.execution: Pull the rope down towards your chest, squeezing your back.
fields.tips: Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the bottom of the movement.

fields.name: T-Bar Rows
fields.description: A back exercise using a T-bar row machine or barbell setup.
fields.starting_position: Stand with a barbell set in a landmine or T-bar row machine.
fields.execution: Pull the handles towards your torso, keeping your chest up and back flat.
fields.tips: Keep your elbows close to your body to focus on your back muscles.
fields.equipment: T-bar row machine or barbell with landmine attachment

fields.name: Barbell Bent Over Rows Supinated Grip
fields.description: A variation of the bent-over row with an underhand grip.
fields.starting_position: Stand with knees slightly bent and grip a barbell with palms facing up.
fields.execution: Pull the barbell towards your torso, keeping your elbows close.
fields.tips: Keep your back flat and avoid rounding your spine.

fields.name: Pull Up
fields.description: A bodyweight exercise targeting the upper back and biceps.
fields.starting_position: Hang from a pull-up bar with your palms facing away from you.
fields.execution: Pull your chin above the bar, then lower back down in a controlled manner.
fields.tips: Engage your core to avoid swinging.

fields.name: Behind the Neck Pull Up
fields.description: A pull-up variation that targets the upper back and shoulders.
fields.starting_position: Hang from a pull-up bar with your hands wider than shoulder-width and palms facing away.
fields.execution: Pull your body upwards, bringing your neck to the bar, then return to the starting position.
fields.tips: Keep your shoulders down and avoid neck strain.

fields.name: Pull Up with a Supinated Grip
fields.description: A variation of the pull-up focusing more on the biceps.
fields.starting_position: Hang from a pull-up bar with palms facing towards you.
fields.execution: Pull yourself up until your chin is above the bar, then slowly lower yourself down.
fields.tips: Control the descent to maximize muscle engagement.

fields.name: Straight Arm Lat Pulldown
fields.description: An isolation exercise targeting the lats.
fields.starting_position: Stand in front of a cable machine, grab the bar with an overhand grip, and pull it down with straight arms.
fields.execution: Pull the bar straight down until it reaches your thighs, then return to the start.
fields.tips: Focus on using your lats, not your arms, to pull the bar.
fields.equipment: Cable machine with straight bar attachment

fields.name: Dumbbell Bent Over Rows
fields.description: A free-weight row exercise for the upper back and lats.
fields.starting_position: Stand with knees slightly bent, holding dumbbells in front of your thighs.
fields.execution: Bend forward at the hips and row the dumbbells towards your waist, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
fields.tips: Don't let your torso swing, focus on controlled movements.

fields.name: Dumbbell Pullover
fields.description: A chest and back exercise targeting the lats and chest muscles.
fields.starting_position: Lie on a bench with a dumbbell held above your chest with both hands.
fields.execution: Lower the dumbbell behind your head in an arc, then pull it back to the starting position.
fields.tips: Keep a slight bend in your elbows during the movement.

fields.name: Barbell Pullover
fields.description: A variation of the pullover, using a barbell for a wider range of motion.
fields.starting_position: Lie on a bench, holding a barbell over your chest with both hands.
fields.execution: Lower the barbell behind your head and then return to the starting position.
fields.tips: Keep your core engaged to prevent arching your back.

fields.name: Barbell Deadlift
fields.description: A compound movement that works the entire body, particularly the posterior chain.
fields.starting_position: Stand with feet hip-width apart and a barbell on the floor in front of you.
fields.execution: Bend at the hips and knees, grab the bar, and lift it while keeping a neutral spine.
fields.tips: Engage your core and keep your back straight throughout the lift.

fields.name: Barbell Sumo Deadlift
fields.description: A variation of the deadlift with a wider stance, emphasizing the inner thighs and glutes.
fields.starting_position: Stand with feet wider than shoulder-width apart, holding the barbell in front of you.
fields.execution: Lower your hips and grip the barbell, then lift it while keeping your back straight.
fields.tips: Keep your knees pushed out and engage your glutes to drive the movement.

fields.name: Trap Bar Deadlift
fields.description: A variation of the deadlift using a trap bar, reducing strain on the back.
fields.starting_position: Stand inside the trap bar, bend down and grab the handles.
fields.execution: Push through your heels to lift the bar, then lower it back down in a controlled manner.
fields.tips: Keep your chest up and back neutral throughout the movement.

fields.name: Dumbbell Deadlift
fields.description: A deadlift variation using dumbbells to target the lower back and hamstrings.
fields.starting_position: Hold a dumbbell in each hand in front of your thighs.
fields.execution: Bend at the hips and knees, lower the dumbbells to the ground, then return to standing.
fields.tips: Engage your core and maintain a flat back during the movement.

fields.name: Barbell Shrug
fields.description: A shrugs exercise using a barbell to target the traps.
fields.starting_position: Stand with a barbell in front of your thighs, hands shoulder-width apart.
fields.execution: Lift your shoulders toward your ears while keeping your arms straight, then lower them back down.
fields.tips: Focus on shrugging with your traps, not your arms.

fields.name: Dumbbell Shrugs
fields.description: A dumbbell exercise to isolate the traps.
fields.starting_position: Hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides, palms facing your body.
fields.execution: Shrug your shoulders up as high as you can, then lower them back down.
fields.tips: Avoid rolling your shoulders; focus on a straight-up shrug.

fields.name: Dumbbell Shoulder Press
fields.description: An overhead press using dumbbells to target the shoulders.
fields.starting_position: Sit or stand with a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height.
fields.execution: Press the dumbbells overhead until your arms are fully extended, then lower them back to shoulder height.
fields.tips: Keep your core tight and avoid arching your lower back.

fields.name: Dumbbell Lateral Raise
fields.description: A shoulder exercise to target the lateral deltoid.
fields.starting_position: Stand with a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
fields.execution: Raise the dumbbells out to the sides, keeping your arms slightly bent, until they are at shoulder height.
fields.tips: Control the movement and avoid swinging the weights.

fields.name: Dumbbell Front Raise
fields.description: A shoulder exercise to target the front deltoid.
fields.starting_position: Stand with a dumbbell in each hand in front of your thighs.
fields.execution: Raise the dumbbells in front of you to shoulder height, then lower them back down.
fields.tips: Avoid using momentum; raise the dumbbells with control.

fields.name: High Cable Rear Delt Fly
fields.description: A cable machine exercise to target the rear delts.
fields.starting_position: Stand in front of a cable machine with the cables at shoulder height.
fields.execution: Pull the cables out to the sides, keeping your arms slightly bent, until they are level with your shoulders.
fields.tips: Focus on using your rear delts and avoid swinging.

fields.name: Smith Machine Shoulder Press
fields.description: An overhead press using the Smith machine for stability.
fields.starting_position: Sit or stand with the barbell at shoulder height on the Smith machine.
fields.execution: Press the barbell overhead until your arms are fully extended, then lower it back to shoulder height.
fields.tips: Engage your core to avoid arching your lower back.

fields.name: Barbell Upright Row
fields.description: An exercise that targets the shoulders and traps using a barbell.
fields.starting_position: Stand with a barbell in front of your thighs, hands shoulder-width apart.
fields.execution: Pull the barbell straight up towards your chin, keeping your elbows out to the sides.

fields.name: Bent-Over Lateral Raise
fields.description: A rear delt exercise to isolate the posterior deltoids.
fields.starting_position: Bend at the waist and hold a dumbbell in each hand with palms facing each other.
fields.execution: Raise the dumbbells out to the sides, keeping your elbows slightly bent, until your arms are parallel to the ground.

fields.name: Cable One-Arm Lateral Raise
fields.description: A lateral raise using a cable machine for continuous tension.
fields.starting_position: Set the cable machine at the lowest setting, and grab the handle with one hand.
fields.execution: Pull the handle out to the side until your arm is at shoulder height, then return to the start.

fields.name: Dumbbell Push Press
fields.description: A standing overhead press using a dumbbell and leg drive for added power.
fields.starting_position: Hold a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height.
fields.execution: Push the dumbbells overhead by using your legs for momentum, then lower them back to shoulder height.

fields.name: Barbell Push Press
fields.description: A standing overhead press using a barbell and leg drive for added power.
fields.starting_position: Stand with a barbell at shoulder height, hands just outside shoulder-width.
fields.execution: Dip down slightly using your knees, then drive the barbell overhead using both your legs and arms.

fields.name: Single-Arm Cable Front Raise
fields.description: A front shoulder raise using a cable machine to target the deltoids.
fields.starting_position: Set the cable machine at the lowest setting and grab the handle with one hand.
fields.execution: Raise the handle in front of you until your arm is at shoulder height, then lower it back down.

fields.name: Barbell Front Raise
fields.description: A front deltoid exercise using a barbell.
fields.starting_position: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and grip the barbell in front of you.
fields.execution: Raise the barbell in front of you until your arms are parallel to the ground, then lower it back down.

fields.name: Seated Barbell Shoulder Press
fields.description: A seated overhead press using a barbell for targeting the shoulders.
fields.starting_position: Sit with a barbell at shoulder height, hands just outside shoulder-width.
fields.execution: Press the barbell overhead until your arms are fully extended, then lower it back to shoulder height.

fields.name: Seated Behind the Neck Barbell Shoulder Press
fields.description: An overhead press targeting the shoulders, performed with the barbell behind the neck.
fields.starting_position: Sit with a barbell behind your neck, hands just outside shoulder-width.
fields.execution: Press the barbell overhead until your arms are fully extended, then lower it back to the starting position.

fields.name: Standing Barbell Shoulder Press
fields.description: A standing overhead press using a barbell to target the shoulders and core.
fields.starting_position: Stand with a barbell at shoulder height, hands just outside shoulder-width.
fields.execution: Press the barbell overhead until your arms are fully extended, then lower it back down.

fields.name: Standing Behind the Neck Barbell Shoulder Press
fields.description: An overhead press with the barbell positioned behind the neck to target the shoulders.
fields.starting_position: Stand with a barbell behind your neck, hands just outside shoulder-width.
fields.execution: Press the barbell overhead until your arms are fully extended, then lower it back down.
fields.tips: Ensure proper posture to avoid strain on the neck and shoulders.

fields.name: Alternate Dumbbell Front Raise Neutral Grip
fields.description: A shoulder exercise using dumbbells to raise one arm at a time with a neutral grip.
fields.starting_position: Stand with a dumbbell in each hand at your sides, palms facing each other.
fields.execution: Raise one dumbbell in front of you until your arm is parallel to the ground, then return and repeat with the other arm.
fields.tips: Keep your core engaged and avoid swinging the dumbbells.

fields.name: One-Arm Low-Pulley Front Raise Neutral Grip
fields.description: A cable machine front raise performed one arm at a time with a neutral grip.
fields.starting_position: Set the cable machine at the lowest setting and grab the handle with one hand.
fields.execution: Pull the handle in front of you until your arm is parallel to the ground, then lower it back down.
fields.tips: Focus on controlled movements to maximize muscle activation.

fields.name: Two-Handed Dumbbell Front Raise
fields.description: A shoulder exercise using both dumbbells to raise your arms to shoulder height.
fields.starting_position: Stand with a dumbbell in each hand in front of your thighs, palms facing your body.
fields.execution: Raise both dumbbells simultaneously in front of you until your arms are parallel to the ground, then lower them back down.
fields.tips: Avoid locking your elbows and keep your chest up.

fields.name: Barbell Curl
fields.description: A standard exercise to target the biceps using a barbell.
fields.starting_position: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and grip the barbell with your palms facing up.
fields.execution: Curl the barbell up towards your chest by bending your elbows, then lower it back to the starting position.
fields.tips: Keep your elbows close to your torso and avoid swinging.

fields.name: Alternating Dumbbell Curl
fields.description: A bicep curl exercise where each arm works alternately using dumbbells.
fields.starting_position: Stand with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing forward.
fields.execution: Curl one dumbbell towards your shoulder while keeping the other arm extended, then lower it back and repeat with the other arm.
fields.tips: Focus on slow, controlled movements to fully engage the biceps.

fields.name: Rope Cable Curl
fields.description: A bicep curl exercise using a rope attachment on a cable machine.
fields.starting_position: Grip the rope attachment with both hands, palms facing each other, and stand upright.
fields.execution: Curl the rope towards your face by bending your elbows, then slowly return to the starting position.
fields.tips: Keep your wrists neutral and avoid jerking the rope.

fields.name: EZ Barbell Curl
fields.description: A curl exercise performed with an EZ curl bar to target the biceps and forearms.
fields.starting_position: Grip the EZ bar with palms facing up, keeping your elbows close to your sides.
fields.execution: Curl the barbell towards your chest by bending your elbows, then slowly lower it back down.
fields.tips: Use a full range of motion to get the most out of each rep.

fields.name: EZ Barbell Preacher Curl
fields.description: A preacher curl using an EZ bar to target the biceps with controlled motion.
fields.starting_position: Sit on the preacher curl bench and grip the EZ bar with your palms facing up.
fields.execution: Curl the bar towards your chest, then lower it back slowly under control.
fields.tips: Make sure your elbows are firmly placed on the bench to isolate the biceps.
fields.equipment: EZ Curl Bar, Preacher Curl Bench

fields.name: Hammer Curl
fields.description: A curl exercise targeting the brachialis muscle using a neutral grip.
fields.starting_position: Hold a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing inward towards your body.
fields.execution: Curl both dumbbells up towards your shoulders while keeping your palms facing each other, then lower them back down.
fields.tips: Avoid swinging the dumbbells and focus on controlling the movement.

fields.name: Incline Dumbbell Curl
fields.description: A bicep curl exercise performed on an incline bench using dumbbells.
fields.starting_position: Sit on an incline bench with a dumbbell in each hand, arms fully extended and palms facing forward.
fields.execution: Curl the dumbbells up towards your shoulders, then lower them slowly back to the starting position.
fields.tips: Focus on controlled movements and avoid swinging your arms.

fields.name: Dumbbell Concentration Curl
fields.description: A bicep curl focusing on isolation by concentrating on one arm at a time.
fields.starting_position: Sit on a bench with a dumbbell in one hand and your elbow resting on your inner thigh.
fields.execution: Curl the dumbbell towards your shoulder while keeping your upper arm stationary, then lower it back down.
fields.tips: Perform this exercise slowly for maximum muscle activation.

fields.name: Single-Arm Low Pulley Cable Curl
fields.description: A cable curl performed one arm at a time, using a low pulley to target the biceps.
fields.starting_position: Stand at a cable machine and grab the low pulley handle with one hand.
fields.execution: Curl the handle towards your shoulder, then slowly lower it back to the starting position.
fields.tips: Maintain good posture and avoid twisting your torso during the movement.

fields.name: Straight Bar Low Pulley Cable Curl
fields.description: A cable curl performed with a straight bar attachment, focusing on the biceps.
fields.starting_position: Grip the straight bar attachment on a low pulley machine with your palms facing up.
fields.execution: Curl the bar towards your chest, then slowly lower it back to the starting position.
fields.tips: Keep your elbows close to your sides to target the biceps more effectively.

fields.name: Standing High Pulley Cable Curl
fields.description: A high pulley curl targeting the biceps with an overhead cable attachment.
fields.starting_position: Stand with your back to a high pulley cable machine, gripping the rope or handle attachment.
fields.execution: Curl the attachment towards your forehead while keeping your upper arms stationary, then return slowly to the start position.
fields.tips: Keep your torso still and focus on the contraction of the biceps.

fields.name: Seated Barbell Wrist Curl
fields.description: A wrist curl targeting the forearms using a barbell while seated.
fields.starting_position: Sit on a bench with your forearms resting on your thighs and a barbell in your hands.
fields.execution: Curl your wrists upward, lifting the barbell, then lower it back to the starting position.
fields.tips: Focus on wrist movement and avoid using your forearms for extra momentum.

fields.name: Seated Barbell Wrist Extension
fields.description: A wrist extension exercise targeting the forearms with a barbell while seated.
fields.starting_position: Sit on a bench with your forearms resting on your thighs and a barbell in your hands.
fields.execution: Extend your wrists upward to lift the barbell, then return to the starting position.
fields.tips: Focus on controlled movements for optimal forearm development.

fields.name: Reverse Barbell Curl
fields.description: A barbell curl performed with a reverse (overhand) grip, targeting the brachioradialis and forearms.
fields.starting_position: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and grip the barbell with an overhand grip, palms facing down.
fields.execution: Curl the barbell upwards towards your chest, keeping your elbows stationary, then lower it back to the starting position.
fields.tips: Maintain a steady motion and avoid swinging the barbell during the curl.

fields.name: Lying Triceps Extension
fields.description: A triceps exercise performed on a bench, often called skull crushers.
fields.starting_position: Lie on a bench and grip a barbell or dumbbells with arms extended above your chest.
fields.execution: Lower the weight towards your forehead by bending your elbows, then extend your arms back to the starting position.
fields.tips: Keep your elbows fixed in place and focus on lowering the weight slowly for maximum activation.

fields.name: Triceps Pressdown
fields.description: A cable machine exercise targeting the triceps.
fields.starting_position: Stand at a cable machine with a rope or bar attachment at the high pulley.
fields.execution: Press the rope or bar down towards your thighs, keeping your upper arms stationary, then return to the starting position.
fields.tips: Control the movement and avoid locking out your elbows at the bottom.

fields.name: Cable Rope Pushdown
fields.description: A variation of the triceps pressdown using a rope attachment.
fields.starting_position: Stand at a cable machine with a rope attachment at the high pulley, palms facing each other.
fields.execution: Push the rope downward by extending your elbows until your arms are fully extended, then return to the starting position.
fields.tips: Focus on controlling the rope throughout the movement, avoiding jerking motions.

fields.name: Dumbbell Overhead Triceps Extension
fields.description: A triceps exercise using a single dumbbell to extend overhead.
fields.starting_position: Sit or stand with a dumbbell in both hands, extending it overhead with your arms fully extended.
fields.execution: Lower the dumbbell behind your head by bending your elbows, then extend your arms back to the starting position.
fields.tips: Keep your elbows stable to target the triceps more effectively.

fields.name: Close Grip Bench Press
fields.description: A bench press variation that focuses on the triceps by narrowing the grip.
fields.starting_position: Lie on a bench and grip the barbell with your hands placed closer together than usual.
fields.execution: Lower the barbell to your chest, then press it back up to the starting position, keeping your elbows close to your body.
fields.tips: Keep your elbows tucked in to minimize shoulder strain and maximize triceps activation.

fields.name: Kickback
fields.description: A triceps exercise where you extend your arm behind you while holding a dumbbell.
fields.starting_position: Stand with one knee on a bench and hold a dumbbell in one hand with your arm bent at 90 degrees.
fields.execution: Extend your arm backward until it is straight, then return it to the starting position.
fields.tips: Avoid swinging the weight; use controlled movements for best results.

fields.name: Reverse Grip Cable Triceps Extension with Barbell
fields.description: A variation of the triceps extension, using a reverse grip and barbell on a cable machine.
fields.starting_position: Stand at a cable machine with a barbell attachment, gripping it with an overhand (reverse) grip.
fields.execution: Extend your arms downward, then slowly return to the starting position.
fields.tips: Keep your elbows close to your body to isolate the triceps.

fields.name: Single-Arm Cable Triceps Extension
fields.description: A triceps extension performed using a cable machine with one arm at a time.
fields.starting_position: Stand at a cable machine and grab the single handle attachment with one hand.
fields.execution: Extend your arm downward, then slowly return to the starting position.
fields.tips: Focus on contracting the triceps at the bottom of the movement for maximum engagement.

fields.name: Single-Arm Cable Triceps Extension with Supinated Grip
fields.description: A triceps extension performed with a supinated (palms-up) grip on a cable machine.
fields.starting_position: Stand at a cable machine and grip the handle with a supinated grip (palms facing up).
fields.execution: Extend your arm downward, keeping your palm facing up, then slowly return to the starting position.
fields.tips: Maintain a slow, controlled movement and focus on the squeeze at the bottom.

fields.name: Lying Dumbbell Triceps Extension
fields.description: A triceps extension exercise performed while lying on a bench with a dumbbell.
fields.starting_position: Lie on a bench with a dumbbell in each hand, arms extended above your chest.
fields.execution: Lower the dumbbells towards your head by bending your elbows, then extend your arms back to the starting position.
fields.tips: Avoid flaring your elbows to keep tension on the triceps throughout the movement.

fields.name: Seated Barbell French Press
fields.description: A triceps exercise using a barbell while seated.
fields.starting_position: Sit on a bench with a barbell held overhead, arms fully extended.
fields.execution: Lower the barbell behind your head by bending your elbows, then extend your arms back to the starting position.
fields.tips: Keep your elbows stationary and avoid flaring them out to ensure maximum triceps activation.

fields.name: Bench Dips
fields.description: A bodyweight exercise targeting the triceps and shoulders using a bench.
fields.starting_position: Sit on the edge of a bench with your hands placed next to your hips, fingers pointing forward.
fields.execution: Lower your body towards the floor by bending your elbows, then push back up to the starting position.
fields.tips: Keep your chest lifted and your elbows close to your body to engage the triceps more effectively.

fields.name: Parallel Dip Bar
fields.description: A dip exercise that focuses on the triceps and chest, performed on parallel dip bars.
fields.starting_position: Grip the parallel bars with your arms fully extended, keeping your body straight.
fields.execution: Lower your body by bending your elbows, then push back up to the starting position.
fields.tips: Maintain an upright torso to focus more on the triceps and avoid excessive chest involvement.

fields.name: Crunch
fields.description: A basic abdominal exercise targeting the rectus abdominis.
fields.starting_position: Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor, hands behind your head.
fields.execution: Lift your shoulders off the floor by engaging your abdominal muscles, then lower back down.
fields.tips: Avoid pulling on your neck; focus on using your abs to lift your torso.

fields.name: Oblique Crunch
fields.description: A variation of the crunch that targets the obliques.
fields.starting_position: Lie on your side with your knees bent, hands behind your head.
fields.execution: Lift your upper body towards your hip, engaging the obliques, then lower back down.
fields.tips: Focus on using your obliques to lift your torso and avoid pulling your neck.

fields.name: Crunch Machine
fields.description: An abdominal exercise performed on a machine that isolates the abs.
fields.starting_position: Sit on the machine with your feet securely placed, hands on the handles.
fields.execution: Crunch your torso forward, squeezing your abs, then slowly return to the starting position.
fields.tips: Control the movement throughout the range of motion and avoid jerking your torso.

fields.name: Rope Ab Pulldown
fields.description: A cable machine exercise that targets the abdominals using a rope attachment.
fields.starting_position: Stand at a cable machine with a rope attachment at the high pulley, gripping the rope with both hands.
fields.execution: Pull the rope down by engaging your abs and bringing your elbows towards your sides, then slowly return to the starting position.
fields.tips: Keep your torso stable and avoid swinging your body to ensure maximum abdominal engagement.

fields.name: Plank
fields.description: A core stabilization exercise that engages the entire body, especially the abs.
fields.starting_position: Start in a push-up position with your forearms on the ground and your body in a straight line.
fields.execution: Hold the position while engaging your core, glutes, and shoulders.
fields.tips: Keep your body in a straight line from head to heels and avoid letting your hips sag.

fields.name: Hanging Leg Raise
fields.description: An advanced abdominal exercise that targets the lower abs.
fields.starting_position: Hang from a pull-up bar with your legs extended straight down.
fields.execution: Lift your legs up towards your chest by engaging your lower abs, then slowly lower them back down.
fields.tips: Avoid swinging your legs; use your abs to lift your legs in a controlled motion.

fields.name: Bent Knee Reverse Crunch
fields.description: A variation of the reverse crunch that targets the lower abs.
fields.starting_position: Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
fields.execution: Lift your hips off the floor by bending your knees towards your chest, then slowly return to the starting position.
fields.tips: Keep the movement slow and controlled to avoid momentum, focusing on the lower abs.

fields.name: Long Arm Crunch
fields.description: A variation of the crunch where the arms are extended overhead, increasing the range of motion.
fields.starting_position: Lie on your back with your arms extended overhead and legs bent.
fields.execution: Lift your torso off the floor by engaging your abs, reaching your hands towards your knees, then lower back down.
fields.tips: Focus on using your abs to lift your torso, keeping your arms extended throughout the movement.

fields.name: Plank Get Ups
fields.description: A dynamic core exercise that challenges stability and strength.
fields.starting_position: Start in a forearm plank position.
fields.execution: Push up onto your hands one arm at a time, then lower yourself back down onto your forearms.
fields.tips: Engage your core to maintain a stable body throughout the movement, avoiding any sagging of the hips.

fields.name: Squat
fields.description: A fundamental lower body exercise targeting the quadriceps, hamstrings, and glutes.
fields.starting_position: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your toes slightly pointed out.
fields.execution: Lower your body by bending your knees, keeping your back straight, until your thighs are parallel to the ground, then push back up.
fields.tips: Keep your chest up, knees behind your toes, and weight on your heels to maintain proper form.

fields.name: Leg Press
fields.description: A machine-based exercise targeting the quadriceps, hamstrings, and glutes.
fields.starting_position: Sit on a leg press machine with your feet placed on the platform, hip-width apart.
fields.execution: Push the platform upward by extending your legs, then slowly lower it back down until your knees are at a 90-degree angle.
fields.tips: Ensure your knees are aligned with your toes throughout the movement to avoid knee strain.

fields.name: Leg Extension
fields.description: A machine-based exercise that isolates the quadriceps.
fields.starting_position: Sit on the leg extension machine with your knees bent and feet under the pad.
fields.execution: Extend your legs until they are fully straight, then slowly return to the starting position.
fields.tips: Control the movement and avoid locking your knees at the top of the extension.

fields.name: Lunge
fields.description: A lower body exercise that targets the quadriceps, hamstrings, and glutes.
fields.starting_position: Stand with your feet together, hands on your hips or by your sides.
fields.execution: Step forward with one leg, lowering your hips until both knees are at 90-degree angles, then push back to the starting position.
fields.tips: Ensure your front knee does not extend beyond your toes to protect the knee joint.

fields.name: Lying Leg Curl
fields.description: A machine-based exercise that isolates the hamstrings.
fields.starting_position: Lie face down on a leg curl machine with your ankles under the pad.
fields.execution: Curl your legs upward, bringing your heels towards your glutes, then slowly lower them back down.
fields.tips: Avoid jerking the weight and control the movement for better hamstring activation.

fields.name: Hack Squat
fields.description: A machine-based squat variation that targets the quadriceps, hamstrings, and glutes.
fields.starting_position: Stand on a hack squat machine with your feet shoulder-width apart and your back against the pad.
fields.execution: Lower your body by bending your knees until your thighs are parallel to the ground, then push back up.
fields.tips: Keep your knees aligned with your toes and avoid letting your back round.

fields.name: Seated Leg Curl
fields.description: A machine-based exercise targeting the hamstrings.
fields.starting_position: Sit on a leg curl machine with your legs extended and the pad resting on your ankles.
fields.execution: Curl your legs upward by engaging your hamstrings, then slowly lower them back down.
fields.tips: Ensure that the movement is slow and controlled to fully engage the hamstrings.

fields.name: Single Leg Extension
fields.description: A machine-based exercise that isolates the quadriceps, performed one leg at a time.
fields.starting_position: Sit on a leg extension machine with one leg extended and the pad resting on your shin.
fields.execution: Extend your leg until it is fully straight, then slowly return to the starting position.
fields.tips: Focus on controlled movement, and avoid jerking the weight to prevent strain.

fields.name: Front Squat
fields.description: A squat variation that focuses more on the quadriceps by keeping the barbell in front of the body.
fields.starting_position: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell across the front of your shoulders with your elbows high.
fields.execution: Squat down by bending your knees and hips, keeping your chest up and your back straight, then press back up to the starting position.
fields.tips: Keep your elbows high and your chest up to maintain proper posture throughout the movement.

fields.name: Dumbbell Stiff-Leg Deadlift
fields.description: A deadlift variation that focuses on the hamstrings and glutes while keeping the legs straight.
fields.starting_position: Stand with a dumbbell in each hand, feet shoulder-width apart, and knees slightly bent.
fields.execution: Hinge at the hips to lower the dumbbells along your legs, keeping your back straight, then return to the starting position by driving your hips forward.
fields.tips: Keep your back neutral and avoid rounding your spine during the descent.

fields.name: Barbell Stiff-Leg Deadlift
fields.description: A deadlift variation using a barbell to target the hamstrings and glutes, with minimal knee bend.
fields.starting_position: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell with an overhand grip in front of your thighs.
fields.execution: Lower the barbell by hinging at your hips, keeping your back straight, then return to the starting position by driving your hips forward.
fields.tips: Avoid bending your knees too much and focus on using your hips to control the movement.

fields.name: Dumbbell Goblet Squat
fields.description: A squat variation where you hold a dumbbell close to your chest to increase the challenge for the core and legs.
fields.starting_position: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell with both hands close to your chest.
fields.execution: Squat down by bending your knees and hips, keeping the dumbbell close to your chest, then press back up to the starting position.
fields.tips: Keep your chest up and core engaged throughout the movement to avoid rounding your back.

fields.name: Knee Tuck Jumps
fields.description: A plyometric exercise that improves power and explosiveness in the legs.
fields.starting_position: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart.
fields.execution: Jump explosively, tucking your knees towards your chest, then land softly and immediately repeat the jump.
fields.tips: Focus on using your core to bring your knees up, and land softly to avoid joint strain.

fields.name: Burpees
fields.description: A full-body exercise that combines a squat, push-up, and jump for cardiovascular and muscular conditioning.
fields.starting_position: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart.
fields.execution: Drop into a squat position, place your hands on the floor, jump your feet back into a plank, perform a push-up, then jump your feet back to your hands and explode upwards into a jump.
fields.tips: Maintain a steady rhythm and focus on proper form during each phase of the movement.

fields.name: Bodyweight Squat
fields.description: A fundamental bodyweight exercise that targets the lower body muscles, primarily the quadriceps, hamstrings, and glutes.
fields.starting_position: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms extended in front of you.
fields.execution: Lower your body by bending your knees and hips, keeping your back straight, then return to the starting position.
fields.tips: Keep your chest up and ensure your knees track over your toes during the squat.

fields.name: 1.5 Rep Bodyweight Squats
fields.description: A squat variation where you squat down, rise halfway, squat back down, and then rise fully.
fields.starting_position: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and arms extended in front of you.
fields.execution: Squat down, rise halfway, squat back down, then rise fully to the starting position.
fields.tips: Focus on controlling each phase of the movement, ensuring proper depth and stability.

fields.name: Medicine Ball Squat
fields.description: A squat variation performed while holding a medicine ball to challenge balance and stability.
fields.starting_position: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a medicine ball with both hands in front of you.
fields.execution: Squat down by bending your knees and hips, keeping the medicine ball in front of your chest, then press back up to the starting position.
fields.tips: Keep your chest up and engage your core to stabilize the medicine ball throughout the squat.

fields.name: Barbell Bulgarian Split Squat
fields.description: A single-leg squat variation that targets the quadriceps, hamstrings, and glutes using a barbell.
fields.starting_position: Stand with one foot forward and the other foot elevated on a bench or platform behind you, holding a barbell across your upper back.
fields.execution: Lower your hips by bending your front knee until your thigh is parallel to the ground, then return to the starting position.
fields.tips: Keep your chest up and ensure your front knee does not go past your toes.

fields.name: Bodyweight Bulgarian Split Squat
fields.description: A single-leg squat variation targeting the quadriceps and glutes using just bodyweight.
fields.starting_position: Stand with one foot forward and the other foot elevated on a bench or platform behind you.
fields.execution: Lower your hips by bending your front knee until your thigh is parallel to the ground, then return to the starting position.
fields.tips: Keep your chest up and your front knee tracking over your toes during the movement.

fields.name: Mini-Band Air Squat
fields.description: A bodyweight squat variation performed with a mini-band around the knees to engage the glutes and hip abductors.
fields.starting_position: Place a mini-band around your knees and stand with your feet shoulder-width apart.
fields.execution: Squat down by bending your knees and hips, keeping tension on the mini-band, then return to the starting position.
fields.tips: Focus on pushing your knees outward to maintain tension on the mini-band throughout the squat.

fields.name: Jump Squat
fields.description: A plyometric variation of the squat that emphasizes explosive power in the lower body.
fields.starting_position: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart.
fields.execution: Squat down, then explode upwards into a jump, landing softly and immediately going into the next squat.
fields.tips: Land softly on your toes and focus on using your legs to control the descent and explosive jump.

fields.name: Wall Sit
fields.description: An isometric exercise that targets the quadriceps by holding a seated position against a wall.
fields.starting_position: Stand with your back against a wall, then slide down into a seated position with your knees at 90 degrees.
fields.execution: Hold the seated position, ensuring your back stays against the wall and your knees remain at 90 degrees.
fields.tips: Engage your core and keep your knees aligned with your toes to avoid unnecessary strain.

fields.name: Medicine Ball Deadlift
fields.description: A deadlift variation using a medicine ball to challenge the hamstrings and glutes while maintaining proper form.
fields.starting_position: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a medicine ball in front of you.
fields.execution: Hinge at your hips and lower the medicine ball towards the floor, then return to the starting position by driving your hips forward.
fields.tips: Keep your back straight and engage your core during the movement.

fields.name: Single Leg Bodyweight Deadlift
fields.description: A single-leg variation of the deadlift that targets the hamstrings, glutes, and core.
fields.starting_position: Stand on one leg with a slight bend in your knee, arms extended in front of you.
fields.execution: Hinge at your hips to lower your torso while keeping your back straight, then return to the starting position by driving your hips forward.
fields.tips: Focus on maintaining balance and stability while keeping your back neutral throughout the movement.

fields.name: Kettlebell Sumo Deadlift
fields.description: A sumo-style deadlift using a kettlebell to target the hamstrings, glutes, and inner thighs.
fields.starting_position: Stand with your feet wider than shoulder-width apart, toes pointed out, holding a kettlebell with both hands in front of you.
fields.execution: Hinge at your hips, lowering the kettlebell between your legs, then drive your hips forward to return to the standing position.
fields.tips: Keep your chest up and back straight, and focus on using your hips to lift the kettlebell.

fields.name: Good Morning
fields.description: A hip-hinge movement that targets the hamstrings, glutes, and lower back.
fields.starting_position: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and a barbell across your upper back.
fields.execution: Hinge at the hips to lower your torso, keeping your back straight, then return to the starting position by driving your hips forward.
fields.tips: Keep a slight bend in your knees and focus on hinging at the hips, not bending at the waist.

fields.name: Bodyweight Glute Bridge
fields.description: A bodyweight exercise that targets the glutes and hamstrings while engaging the core.
fields.starting_position: Lie on your back with your knees bent, feet flat on the floor, and arms at your sides.
fields.execution: Lift your hips off the floor by contracting your glutes, forming a straight line from your shoulders to your knees, then lower back down.
fields.tips: Squeeze your glutes at the top of the movement and avoid arching your lower back.

fields.name: Single Leg Glute Bridge
fields.description: A single-leg variation of the glute bridge that increases the intensity and isolates each leg.
fields.starting_position: Lie on your back with one knee bent and foot flat on the floor, while the other leg is extended straight.
fields.execution: Lift your hips off the floor by contracting your glutes, keeping the extended leg straight, then lower back down.
fields.tips: Focus on driving through your heel and keeping your hips level throughout the movement.

fields.name: Banded Glute Bridge
fields.description: A glute bridge variation performed with a resistance band around the knees to increase glute activation.
fields.starting_position: Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor, and a resistance band around your knees.
fields.execution: Lift your hips by squeezing your glutes, while maintaining tension on the band, then lower back down.
fields.tips: Ensure that your knees are pushing outward against the band throughout the movement.

fields.name: Duck Walk
fields.description: A dynamic lower body exercise that engages the glutes, quads, and hamstrings while also improving mobility and stability.
fields.starting_position: Squat down low with your knees bent and your feet flat on the ground.
fields.execution: Step forward with one foot while maintaining a squat position, then alternate legs as you move forward.
fields.tips: Keep your torso upright and maintain a low squat position to target the legs effectively.

fields.name: Bird Dog
fields.description: A core exercise that targets the lower back, glutes, and shoulders while improving balance and stability.
fields.starting_position: Begin on all fours with your hands directly under your shoulders and your knees under your hips.
fields.execution: Extend your right arm forward and left leg back, keeping your torso stable, then return to the starting position and switch sides.
fields.tips: Keep your core engaged to maintain stability throughout the movement.

fields.name: Groiners
fields.description: A dynamic movement that combines a lunge and a squat to engage the lower body and core.
fields.starting_position: Start in a standing position with your feet shoulder-width apart.
fields.execution: Jump into a squat position and then step one foot forward into a lunge, alternating sides while keeping your torso upright.
fields.tips: Focus on landing softly and controlling the movement to avoid strain on your knees.

fields.name: Fire Hydrants
fields.description: An exercise that targets the glutes, particularly the hip abductors, while improving hip mobility.
fields.starting_position: Start on all fours with your hands under your shoulders and knees under your hips.
fields.execution: Lift one leg out to the side, keeping the knee bent at 90 degrees, then return to the starting position and alternate sides.
fields.tips: Keep your core engaged to prevent any excessive movement in your lower back.

fields.name: Smith Machine Hip Thrust
fields.description: A hip thrust variation performed with the Smith machine to increase glute and hamstring activation.
fields.starting_position: Sit on the floor with your upper back against a bench and a barbell across your hips.
fields.execution: Push through your heels to lift your hips towards the ceiling, fully extending your hips at the top, then lower back down.
fields.tips: Ensure that your back is flat against the bench and your chin is tucked during the movement.

fields.name: Barbell Hip Thrust
fields.description: A barbell version of the hip thrust to target the glutes, hamstrings, and lower back muscles.
fields.starting_position: Sit on the floor with your upper back resting against a bench, feet flat on the floor and barbell placed across your hips.
fields.execution: Push your hips upward by driving through your heels, fully extending your hips at the top, then lower back down.
fields.tips: Maintain a neutral spine throughout the movement and focus on squeezing your glutes at the top.

fields.name: Band Seated Hip Abduction
fields.description: A hip abduction exercise performed with a resistance band to strengthen the hip abductors and glutes.
fields.starting_position: Sit on a bench with a resistance band around your legs, just above your knees, feet flat on the floor.
fields.execution: Push your knees outward against the band, then slowly return to the starting position.
fields.tips: Focus on controlling the movement both as you push out and return to the starting position.

fields.name: Seated Hip Abduction Machine
fields.description: A machine-based exercise that isolates the hip abductors and glutes.
fields.starting_position: Sit on the abduction machine with your feet on the pads and knees bent at 90 degrees.
fields.execution: Push your legs outward, engaging the hip abductors, then return to the starting position.
fields.tips: Keep your back pressed against the seat and focus on pushing through your outer thighs.

fields.name: Standing Cable Abduction
fields.description: A cable machine exercise that targets the hip abductors and glutes.
fields.starting_position: Stand next to a cable machine with the ankle strap attached to your outer ankle.
fields.execution: Lift your leg outward away from your body, keeping your core stable, then slowly return to the starting position.
fields.tips: Maintain a slight bend in your standing leg and avoid swinging the leg to maintain tension on the cable.

fields.name: Bodyweight Frog Pump
fields.description: A glute-focused bodyweight exercise that targets the hip flexors and glutes.
fields.starting_position: Lie on your back with your feet together and knees bent outward, hands at your sides.
fields.execution: Thrust your hips upward by engaging your glutes, then lower back down.
fields.tips: Squeeze your glutes at the top of the movement and avoid using your lower back to lift your hips.

fields.name: Smith Machine Frog Pump
fields.description: A Smith machine variation of the frog pump that increases resistance and targets the glutes.
fields.starting_position: Lie on your back under the Smith machine with your feet together and knees bent outward, the barbell resting on your hips.
fields.execution: Drive your hips upward, engaging your glutes, then slowly lower back down.
fields.tips: Focus on using your glutes to thrust your hips up, and avoid arching your lower back.

fields.name: Banded Clams
fields.description: A glute activation exercise performed with a resistance band to target the hip abductors and glutes.
fields.starting_position: Lie on your side with your knees bent at 90 degrees, a resistance band around your thighs just above your knees.
fields.execution: Open your knees outward against the resistance of the band, keeping your feet together, then return to the starting position.
fields.tips: Keep your core engaged and avoid rotating your hips during the movement.

fields.name: Side Lying Leg Raise
fields.description: An exercise that targets the hip abductors and glutes by raising the leg while lying on your side.
fields.starting_position: Lie on your side with your legs stacked and your bottom arm supporting your head.
fields.execution: Lift your top leg toward the ceiling, keeping it straight, then lower back down without letting it touch the other leg.
fields.tips: Keep your body aligned and avoid leaning back during the movement.

fields.name: Glute Ham Raise
fields.description: A challenging exercise that targets the hamstrings, glutes, and lower back by raising the upper body from a prone position.
fields.starting_position: Position yourself on a glute-ham raise machine with your feet secured and your body leaning forward.
fields.execution: Extend your hips and knees to raise your torso, then slowly lower back to the starting position.
fields.tips: Engage your hamstrings and glutes throughout the movement and avoid using momentum.

fields.name: Dumbbell Step Up
fields.description: An exercise that targets the quads, glutes, and hamstrings by stepping up onto a platform with dumbbells in hand.
fields.starting_position: Stand in front of a bench or platform with a dumbbell in each hand.
fields.execution: Step up onto the platform with one leg, pressing through your heel, then step down and repeat with the opposite leg.
fields.tips: Make sure your knee does not extend beyond your toes when stepping up.

fields.name: Lateral Mini-Band Walk
fields.description: A lateral movement that targets the hip abductors and glutes using a mini-band.
fields.starting_position: Place a mini-band around your thighs just above your knees and stand with feet shoulder-width apart.
fields.execution: Step to the side with one leg, followed by the other leg, maintaining tension on the band and keeping your knees bent.
fields.tips: Keep your core engaged and avoid letting your knees cave inward during the movement.

fields.name: Standing Knee Raise
fields.description: An exercise that targets the hip flexors and core while raising the knee towards the chest.
fields.starting_position: Stand with your feet hip-width apart and your hands placed on your hips or at your sides.
fields.execution: Lift one knee towards your chest, keeping your torso upright, then lower it back down and repeat with the opposite knee.
fields.tips: Maintain good posture and avoid leaning back as you raise your knee.

fields.name: Kettlebell Swings
fields.description: A full-body movement that targets the glutes, hamstrings, and core, using a kettlebell to swing the weight.
fields.starting_position: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and a kettlebell between your legs, holding it with both hands.
fields.execution: Swing the kettlebell forward by hinging at your hips and thrusting your hips forward, then swing it back down and repeat.
fields.tips: Use your hips to power the swing, not your arms, and keep your back flat throughout.

fields.name: Standing Cable Kickback
fields.description: A cable machine exercise that targets the glutes and hamstrings by extending the leg backward.
fields.starting_position: Stand facing a cable machine with the ankle strap attached to your ankle.
fields.execution: Kick your leg back, keeping your knee straight and foot flexed, then return to the starting position.
fields.tips: Keep your torso stable and avoid arching your back as you extend your leg.

fields.name: Donkey Kicks
fields.description: A glute activation exercise performed on all fours that targets the glutes and hip flexors.
fields.starting_position: Start on all fours with your knees under your hips and your hands under your shoulders.
fields.execution: Kick one leg up and back while keeping the knee bent, then lower it back to the starting position and repeat on the other side.
fields.tips: Keep your core tight and avoid arching your lower back as you lift your leg.

fields.name: Side Lying Hip Raise
fields.description: An exercise that targets the glutes and outer thighs by lifting your hips off the ground while lying on your side.
fields.starting_position: Lie on your side with your bottom arm supporting your head and your legs straight.
fields.execution: Lift your hips off the floor, creating a straight line from your head to your feet, then lower back down.
fields.tips: Engage your core and avoid letting your lower back sag during the movement.

fields.name: Squat Sit to Reach
fields.description: A mobility exercise that combines a squat with a reach to improve flexibility and lower body strength.
fields.starting_position: Start in a squat position with your feet shoulder-width apart and your hands in front of your chest.
fields.execution: Sit back into the squat, then reach one arm forward, alternating sides with each squat.
fields.tips: Keep your chest up and your knees tracking over your toes during the squat.

fields.name: Seated Calf Raise
fields.description: An exercise to target the calf muscles by raising the heels while seated.
fields.starting_position: Sit on a calf raise machine or a bench with your feet flat on the floor and your knees bent.
fields.execution: Raise your heels as high as possible, then slowly lower back down.
fields.tips: Pause at the top of the movement and focus on squeezing your calves.

fields.name: Standing Calf Raise
fields.description: A calf exercise performed in a standing position to isolate the calf muscles.
fields.starting_position: Stand with your feet hip-width apart, either on the ground or on a raised platform.
fields.execution: Raise your heels as high as possible, then lower them back down.
fields.tips: Keep your legs straight and focus on using the calves to lift your heels.
